content: Xucong ZhangSearch this siteEmbedded FilesSkip to main contentSkip to navigationHome        PublicationXucong Zhang(Tenured) Assistant ProfessorIntelligent Systems DepartmentFaculty of EEMCSDelft University of Technology (TU Delft) E-Mail: xucong.zhang [AT] tudelft.nlOffice: Room 6.E.320 Van Mourik Broekmanweg 6 (building 28) 2628 XE  Delft NetherlandsLinks: Google Scholar, LinkedInI am on an academic visit from October 2025 to April 2026 and working in the VLG group at ETH Zürich.Research InterestFrom Gaze to Full-body Intelligence: Building on my experience in gaze estimation and its applications, I focus on embodied visual intelligence through holistic human motion modeling and AI motion generation, including gaze, face, hand, and full-body dynamics. This research aims to support the development of human-robot collaboration and realistic avatar generation.Heathcare: I am working on the intersection of computer vision, medical, and healthcare research, aiming to develop tools that support clinical practice and benefit society at large.Short BioI joined TU Delft in 2021 as an assistant professor and was granted a permanent position in 2023. I was a postdoc from 2018 to 2021 at ETH Zurich in Switzerland, led by Prof. Otmar Hilliges. I received my PhD (summa cum laude) from the Max Planck Institute for Informatics in Germany, under the supervision of Prof. Andreas Bulling.I am also a Guest Scientist at the Max Planck Institute for Intelligent Systems, an ELLIS Scholar, and an IEEE senior member. Funding (1.5M EUR, including 950k EUR as sole PI)DFG UGaze Programme, "WeGaze: Large-scale Gaze Analysis via Multi-camera System for Social Interactions".
